messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE FILE: #K-7812-RT DATE: 12/14/30  Late in the evening of December 14, an art heist took place at the renowned Museum of Modern Marvels. A priceless Van Gogh painting, The Sunlit Meadow, was stolen. Given the prominence of the artwork and the museum's reputation, an elite law enforcement team was promptly assembled to solve the case and recover the stolen painting.  LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE:  INITIAL SCENE ASSESSMENT: Detective W. X. Y. Brooks, having a track record with high-profile thefts, immediately took charge, organizing a systematic review of the museum's security protocols and camera feeds. FORENSIC ANALYSIS: Criminalist Z. A. B. Hansen meticulously examined the display area where the painting was hung, retrieving fingerprints and other potential evidence. WITNESS INTERROGATION: Detective C. D. E. Rivera focused on interviewing museum staff and any patrons present during the theft, gleaning potential leads. MUSEUM LIAISON: Captain F. G. H. Knight worked closely with the museum's director and security personnel, ensuring clear communication and collaboration between the institution and law enforcement. SURVEILLANCE: Patrol Officer I. J. K. Lawrence and her team scanned surrounding areas, looking for any suspicious activities or individuals. STRATEGY & PLANNING: Captain L. M. N. O'Reilly devised a detailed plan to trace the stolen artwork, including collaborating with international agencies and art dealers. Within a week, thanks to the combined efforts of the team and their extensive expertise, valuable leads were established. The case garnered significant media attention, emphasizing the importance of the officers' dedication and diligence.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Detective W. X. Y. Brooks  
Officer Context: Detective Brooks took charge of the initial scene assessment and reviewed the museum's security measures.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Criminalist Z. A. B. Hansen  
Officer Context: Criminalist Hansen was responsible for examining the display area for forensic evidence.  
Officer Role: Criminalist 

Officer Name: Detective C. D. E. Rivera  
Officer Context: Detective Rivera interviewed museum staff and patrons for potential leads.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Captain F. G. H. Knight  
Officer Context: Captain Knight liaised with museum officials, ensuring effective collaboration.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer I. J. K. Lawrence  
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Lawrence led a team in surveying the surrounding areas for any signs of suspicious activity.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Captain L. M. N. O'Reilly  
Officer Context: Captain O'Reilly strategized and coordinated efforts to trace the stolen artwork.  
Officer Role: Captain
